description: Checking consistency between service agreement, statement of work, and invoice terms
expected_issues: Payment terms differ: Agreement states 30 days, SOW states 45 days, Invoice states 15 days
Deliverable descriptions don't match between documents
Liability caps are different in MSA vs SOW
Termination clauses have conflicting notice periods

documents.title: Master Service Agreement
documents.content:
MASTER SERVICE AGREEMENT

This Master Service Agreement ("MSA") is entered into on June 1, 2023 ("Effective Date") between:

Acme Technology Ltd. ("Service Provider")
AND
Global Enterprises Inc. ("Client")

1. SERVICES

Service Provider shall provide software development, consulting, and related services as described in Statements of Work ("SOW") executed under this MSA.

2. TERM AND TERMINATION

2.1 Term: This MSA shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial period of three (3) years, automatically renewing for successive one-year terms unless either party provides 90 days' written notice of non-renewal.

2.2 Termination for Convenience: Either party may terminate this MSA or any SOW by providing sixty (60) days' written notice to the other party.

2.3 Termination for Cause: Either party may terminate immediately upon written notice if the other party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to cure within thirty (30) days of receiving written notice.

3. FEES AND PAYMENT

3.1 Fees for services shall be specified in each SOW.

3.2 Payment Terms: Client shall pay all undisputed invoices within thirty (30) days of invoice date.

3.3 Late Payment: Overdue amounts shall accrue interest at the rate of 1.5% per month (or the maximum rate permitted by law, if lower).

3.4 Expenses: Client shall reimburse Service Provider for reasonable, pre-approved expenses incurred in connection with services.

4. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

4.1 Pre-existing IP: Each party retains ownership of its pre-existing intellectual property.

4.2 Work Product: All work product, deliverables, and intellectual property created specifically for Client under this Agreement shall be the sole property of Client upon full payment.

4.3 License: Service Provider may use generic tools, methodologies, and know-how developed during the engagement for other clients, provided no Client confidential information is disclosed.

5. WARRANTIES

5.1 Service Provider warrants that:
a) Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner
b) Services will conform to specifications in the applicable SOW
c) Work product will not infringe third-party intellectual property rights

5.2 Warranty Period: Ninety (90) days from delivery of each deliverable.

5.3 Remedy: Service Provider shall re-perform non-conforming services or refund fees for services that cannot be corrected.

6. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

6.1 Cap: Each party's total aggregate liability under this MSA shall not exceed the total fees paid or payable under the applicable SOW in the twelve (12) months preceding the claim, with an absolute maximum of USD $500,000.

6.2 Exclusions: Neither party shall be liable for indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages.

6.3 Exceptions: Liability cap does not apply to:
- Intellectual property infringement claims
- Breach of confidentiality
- Gross negligence or willful misconduct
- Indemnification obligations

7. INSURANCE

Service Provider shall maintain:
- Professional liability insurance: USD $2,000,000
- General liability insurance: USD $1,000,000
- Cyber liability insurance: USD $1,000,000

8. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of Hong Kong SAR, and parties submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of Hong Kong courts.

documents.title: Statement of Work #007 - Mobile App Development
documents.content:
STATEMENT OF WORK NO. 007

This Statement of Work ("SOW") is entered into pursuant to the Master Service Agreement dated June 1, 2023 between Acme Technology Ltd. and Global Enterprises Inc.

SOW Effective Date: January 15, 2024

PROJECT: Mobile Application Development - Customer Portal

1. SCOPE OF WORK

Acme Technology shall design, develop, and deploy a mobile application for Global Enterprises' customer portal with the following features:

Phase 1 - Design (6 weeks):
- User research and requirements gathering
- UI/UX design for iOS and Android
- Design system and component library
- Interactive prototypes
- Design review and approval

Deliverables:
- User research report
- Design specifications document
- Interactive Figma prototypes
- Design asset library

Phase 2 - Development (16 weeks):
- Native iOS app development (Swift)
- Native Android app development (Kotlin)
- Backend API integration
- User authentication and authorization
- Core features implementation:
  * Account management
  * Product catalog browsing
  * Order placement and tracking
  * Payment processing integration
  * Push notifications
  * In-app messaging

Deliverables:
- Source code (repository access)
- iOS app (TestFlight beta)
- Android app (Google Play beta)
- API documentation
- Technical documentation

Phase 3 - Testing & Launch (4 weeks):
- Quality assurance testing
- User acceptance testing support
- Bug fixes and refinements
- App store submissions
- Production deployment

Deliverables:
- Test reports and bug tracking log
- Deployment documentation
- App store listings (iOS and Android)
- Training materials for support team

2. PROJECT TIMELINE

Total Duration: 26 weeks from SOW effective date

Milestone Schedule:
- M1: Design Approval - Week 6
- M2: Development Alpha - Week 14
- M3: Development Beta - Week 20
- M4: Production Launch - Week 26

3. FEES AND PAYMENT SCHEDULE

Total Project Fee: USD $280,000 (fixed price)

Payment Milestones:
- 20% (USD $56,000) upon SOW execution
- 20% (USD $56,000) upon Phase 1 completion and acceptance
- 30% (USD $84,000) upon Phase 2 completion and acceptance
- 20% (USD $56,000) upon successful launch to app stores
- 10% (USD $28,000) thirty (30) days after production launch

Payment Terms: Invoices due within forty-five (45) days of invoice date.

4. RESOURCES

Acme Technology Team:
- Project Manager (25% allocation)
- UI/UX Designer (2 resources, full-time for Phase 1)
- iOS Developer (1 resource, full-time for Phases 2-3)
- Android Developer (1 resource, full-time for Phases 2-3)
- Backend Developer (1 resource, 50% allocation)
- QA Engineer (1 resource, full-time for Phase 3)

Client Responsibilities:
- Product Owner (weekly availability)
- Subject matter experts for requirements
- UAT testers
- Timely feedback and approvals
- Access to existing systems and APIs
- Content and branding materials

5. ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA

Deliverables shall be deemed accepted if:
a) Delivered in accordance with specifications
b) Pass agreed-upon acceptance tests
c) No critical or high-priority defects
d) Client provides written acceptance OR 10 business days pass without rejection

If deliverables are rejected, Acme shall have 15 business days to remedy defects at no additional cost.

6. CHANGES AND VARIATIONS

Any changes to scope, timeline, or fees must be documented in a written change order signed by both parties. Acme will provide estimates for requested changes within 5 business days.

7. ASSUMPTIONS AND DEPENDENCIES

- Client will provide API access and documentation within 2 weeks of SOW execution
- Client will provide timely feedback (within 5 business days)
- No major changes to requirements after Phase 1 approval
- Third-party services (payment gateway, push notifications) are already contracted
- Client has necessary app store developer accounts

8. TERMINATION

Either party may terminate this SOW with thirty (30) days' written notice. Upon termination:
- Client pays for all completed milestones
- Client pays for work in progress on a pro-rata basis
- Acme delivers all work product completed to date
- IP provisions of MSA apply to completed work

9. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

For this SOW, Service Provider's maximum liability shall not exceed the total fees under this SOW (USD $280,000).

10. WARRANTY

Acme warrants that the application will perform in accordance with specifications for sixty (60) days following production launch. Post-warranty support available under separate maintenance agreement.
